result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan L Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donovan L Perkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donovan L Perkins was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Donovan L Perkins was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Donovan L Perkins was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Donovan L Perkins was found guilty of Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including DA service fees, and DNA surcharge.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
--------------------------------

Maintain employment, school, or a combination of the two, OR if at Agent's discretion, Agent believes child care provided by the defendant is appropriate.
--------------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No driving without a valid license.
--------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Undergo any evaluation ordered by the Agent and follow through with any recommendations of that evaluation.
--------------------------------

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain employment, school, or a combination of the two, OR if at Agent's discretion, Agent believes child care provided by the defendant is appropriate.
No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

miscConds.notes:
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
--------------------------------

timeConds.notes:
to commence on or before August 7, 2017 @ 8:00 a.m. NOTE: Defendant is to serve the first four (4) months of conditional jail time with NO work release privileges. Remaining eight (8) months of conditional jail time may be served WITH work release privileges.
------------------------------------
*AMENDMENTS 08/17/2017 - Work release privileges is for work and child care. Conditional probation and jail time may transfer to Milwaukee County.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to each other but Consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $16,114.22 and restitution surcharges. PLEASE NOTE: Defendant's bond money in the amount of $5,000.00 has been applied toward the restitution ordered.
--------------------------------

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to each other but Consecutive to any other sentence.

2:37 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Donovan L Perkins in court with Atty Rebecca M Coffee.  
Matter is on this afternoon for Mr. Perkins' sentencing hearing.  
Court makes record as to the charges and penalties.  
A PSI has been prepared and the Court has reviewed it.  
State will not make a specific recommendation but just general arguments.  
Atty Leusink makes record with regard to victim notification.  A request for restitution has been filed.  
Court has reviewed the letters of support submitted by Atty Coffee.  
Atty Coffee asks if Court wishes to first address the OWI 1st.  
Court has plea colloquy with Mr. Perkins.  
Defendant enters GUILTY plea to 2015TR006118.  
Atty Coffee makes record as to one correction to PSI - on page 9.  
2:43 pm  Statement by deft's mother, Towanda Perkins.  
2:48 pm  Argument by Atty Leusink.  
2:53 pm  Argument by Atty Coffee.  
3:13 pm  Statement of apology by defendant.  
3:15 pm  Response by defendant to Court's questions.  
3:18 pm  Court proceeds with sentencing Mr. Perkins.  

SENTENCE:  
On 2015TR6118:  $300 forf plus costs; 9 months revocation of DL; A & R;  

On file 2015CF492:  
Withheld sentence:  
3 years probation on Ct 1;  
5 years probation on Cts 2, 4 & 5;  
163 days of sentence credit if probation is revoked.  

Conditions of probation:  
1)  On Ct 4 - 12 months in WCJ commencing on 08/07/2017, WITHOUT work release privileges for the first 4 months; and after that, he may have work release for remaining 8 months;  
2)  No alcohol.  No drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No driving without a valid license.  
3)  No weapons.  
4)  Pay restitution in the amount of $16,114.22.  
5)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  
6)  Maintain employment, school or a combination of the two, or if at Agent's discretion, Agent believes child care provided by defendant is appropriate.  
7)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
8)  Undergo any evaluation ordered by the Agent and follow through with any recommendations of that evaluation.  

Court warns deft:  1)  May not vote until civil rights are restored;  2)  May not possess firearms;  3)  May not possess body armor;  3:36 pm  Court in recess.

2:30 PM FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  Defendant Donovan L Perkins in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is scheduled for JT on Monday and Tuesday of next week.  Attorney May has filed a Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  Defendant is in the process of retaining Attorney Matthew Meyer.  Atty Meyer was not available for Court today but would be available on September 21st at 1:15 pm  Attorney Herrmann makes a record with regard to ADA Donohoo's offer in this case.  If the defendant does not accept that offer, there will be no other offers made by the State.  Court has colloquy with the defendant concerning the State's offer.  He is rejecting that offer and understands it will be going away.  Record is made by the State with regard to victim notification.  Court grants Attorney May's Motion to withdraw as counsel and continues this for a status hearing.  The jury trial scheduled for next week is being canceled at this time.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Atty Julia May

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.Y.S. OR HER RESIDENCE.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
